Course Description: Recommender systems have around for sometime. But in recent times with the boom of retail online trade recommendation systems and the hype around the NetFlix competition has made recommender systems a major topic in data mining. In this course we will learn about different aspects of recommender systems with particular emphasis on its algorithms.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students will be able to demonstrate an understanding of concepts of recommender systems.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students will be able to implement both primitive (neighbourhood models) and state-of-the-art (latent factor models) algorithms for recommender systems.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students will be able to implement advanced projects in this area.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students will be able to implement advanced projects in this area.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: What is a recommender system? Applications and Motivations
Explicit vs Implicit Ratings – advantages and disadvantages
Bias Prediction – predicting user and item biases (statistical and optimization based methods)
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Quiz#1: Implementing bias prediction in class

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Rating Prediction – local / neighbourhood models (Including review of some machine learning concepts – clustering, regression, classification)
Rating Prediction – latent factor models / global models (modeling the problem as a matrix completion, theoretical guarantees, algorithms and performances)

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Assignment#3: Implement hybrid model from papers

Resource Material.Reference Book: Recommender Systems Handbook, Ricci, F., Rokach, L., Shapira, B., Kantor, P.B. (Eds.), Springer
